ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Six-month follow-up completed
Are you seeing psychiatrist currently
Frequency of appointments with psychiatrist (number of visits per month)
Currently seeing any other mental health professional(s)
Type of Mental Health provider
Second mental health provider
Third mental health provider

Are you currently taking any medication for a psychiatric or neurology problem (such as an antidepressant, an
anti-anxiety medication, a mood stabilizer, an antipsychotic or an anticonvulsant? (See back of this sheet for names
of medications).
New or worsening health problem(s) or change(s) since study completion
If new or worsening health problem or change since study completion, condition 1
If another new or worsening health problem or change since study completion, condition 2
If another new or worsening health problem or change since study completion, condition 3
If another new or worsening health problem or change since study completion, condition 4
Inpatient hospital admissions for psychiatric treatment since study completion
Number of Psychiatric Hospitalizations
Total duration of psychiatric hospitalizations (days)
Inpatient medical admissions for psychiatric treatment since study completion
Number of medical hospitalizations
Total days hospitalized
